Translations.Text: Successful indeed are the believers (or the believers will eventually win)
Who in their prayers are humble
And who shun vain talk
And who are constantly active in charitable works
And who abstain from sexual immodesty (or guard their modesty or chastity or sexual purity)
Except for with those joined with them in marriage or the captive whom their right hand possesses, for then, verily, they are free from blame
But whoever craves aught beyond that, they are the transgressors
And those who faithfully observe their trusts and covenants
And who guard well (pay heed to) their prayers
These will be the heirs
Who shall inherit Paradise; they shall dwell therein
We have created man from an extract of clay
Then We made him a drop (sperm) in a safe depository (the womb)

Then We made the drop into a clot, and We made the clot into a lump (foetus); then We made the lump into bone, and We clothed the bone with flesh; then We produced from it another creature. Blessed be Allah, the best of Creators
Then shall you after that surely die
Then, lo! On the Day of Resurrection shall you surely be raised
And We have created above you seven paths; and We are never heedless of creation
And We send down from the heaven water by measure, and We make it rest in the earth; but, verily, We are able to withdraw it
Then We produce for you thereby gardens of date-palms and grapes wherein you have much fruits, and whereof you eat
And a tree growing out of Mount Sinai (Olives) which produces oil, and a relish for eaters
And, verily, you have a lesson in the cattle; We give you to drink of what is in their bodies; and you have therein many uses, and of them you eat
And on them and on ships you are carried
We sent Noah unto his people, and he said, "O my people! Serve Allah, you have no God but Him; do you then not fear (evil)

Said the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people, "This is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who wishes to make himself superior to you. Had Allah pleased He could surely have sent angels. We have not heard of this from our forefathers
He is nothing but a man possessed; so watch him for a while
Said he, "My Lord! Help me, for they deny me

And We inspired him, saying "Make the ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration; and when the oven (of Allah´s wrath) boils over (or the fountains or springs of the earth are about to gush forth), conduct into it of every kind two spouses, and you
But when you are settled, you and those with you in the ark, say, "Praise belongs to Allah, Who saved us from the unjust people
And say, ´My Lord! Cause me to land on a blessed landing place, for you are the best of all who bring to land.´
Verily, in this is a sign, and, verily, We are ever trying them (mankind)
Then We raised up after them another generation
And We sent amongst them a messenger of their own (or from among them), saying, "Serve Allah, you have no God but He; will you then not fear (evil)

Said the chiefs of the people who disbelieved, and denied the meeting in the Hereafter, and to whom We gave enjoyment in the life of this world, "This is only a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat, and drinks of what you drink
If you obey a mortal like yourselves, verily, you will then be surely losers
Does he promise you that when you are dead, and have become dust and bones, that then you will be brought forth
Be gone, be gone, with that which you are promised (or it is far-fetched)
There is only our life in this world. We die and we live, and we shall not be raised again
He is only a man who invents a lie about Allah. And we believe him not
Said he, "My Lord! Help me, for they deny me
He said, "Within a little while they will surely be sorry
Then the blast seized them rightfully; and We made them as rubbish borne by a torrent (of Time); so, away with the wrong-doing people
Then after them We brought forth other generations
No nation (or people) can hasten its appointed term, nor delay it

Then We sent Our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came unto any nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to disaster); and We made them bywords. Away then with a people who believe not
Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs, and with plain authority
To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they were inflated with pride, and were a despotic people
And they said, "Shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, and whose people are servile unto us
So they accused them of lying, and became of those who perished
And We verily gave Moses the Book, that per chance (or possibly) they might be guided
And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign; and We gave them both shelter on high, a place of security and springs
O you messengers! Eat of the good things and do right; verily, I am aware of what you do
And, verily, this your religion (or brotherhood) is one religion (or brotherhood), and I am your Lord; so keep your duty unto Me
But they (mankind) have broken their religion (or affair) between them into sects, each sect rejoicing in its own tenets
So leave them in their confused error (or ignorance) for a time
Think they that in the wealth and children, wherewith We provide them
We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not
Verily, those who walk in awe of their Lord
And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord
And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lord
And those who give what they give with heart afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord
These race to good things, and they shall be the first in the race
But We will not oblige a soul beyond its capacity; for with us is a Record that utters the truth, and they shall not be wronged
Nay, their heart are in ignorance of this, and they do deeds beside this which they continue to do
Until, when We catch the affluent ones amongst them with the punishment, then lo! They cry in supplication
Supplicate not this day! Assuredly, you will not be helped by (or against) Us
My revelations were recited to you, but you turned back upon your heels
In arrogant scorn thereof, raving vain nonsensical tales by night
Have they not pondered over the words, or has something new come unto them which came not to their forefathers
Or know they not their messenger that they thus deny him
Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, but he came to them with the Truth, and most of them are haters of Truth

But if the truth were to conform to their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth and whoever is therein would be corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Reminder (The Quran), but from their Reminder they now turn away
Or do you ask them for a tribute? But the bounty of your Lord is better, for He is the best of those who provide
And, verily, you do call them to the Straight Way
But, verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, they are indeed astray from that Way
But if We had mercy on them, and relieved their distress, they still would persist in their rebellion, blindly wandering on
And We caught them with the punishment, but they humble not themselves before their Lord, nor do they pray
Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme torment, then lo! They are plunged into despair
He it is who produced for you hearing and sight, and heart (or feelings, understanding, mind). Little thanks give you
And He it is Who has sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him shall you be gathered
And He it is Who gives you life and death; and His is the alternation of the night and the day; have you then no sense
Nay, but they say the like of that which those of yore did say
They said, "What! When we have become earth and bones, are we then going to be raised again
We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but old folks´ tales
Say, "Whose is the earth and those who are therein, if you have knowledge
They will say, "Allah´s." Say, "Will you then not remember
Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Mighty Throne
They will say, "Allah." Say, "Will you then not keep your duty unto Him
Say, "In whose hand is the dominion over all things; He succours (or protects) but is not succoured (or needs no protection or against whom there is no protection), if you did but know
They will say, "Allah´s". Say, "How then can you be so deluded
Nay, We have brought them the Truth, but, verily, they are Liars

Allah never took a son, nor was there ever any God with Him; else would each God have assuredly gone off with (or championed, controlled) that which he had created, and some would assuredly have exalted themselves over (or overcome) others. Glorified be A
Knower of the invisible and the visible, exalted be He above what they associate with Him
Say, "My Lord! if you should show me what they are promised
My Lord! Then place me not amongst the wrong-doing people
And verily We are able to show you that which We have promised them
Repel evil by that which is best. We are best Aware of that which they allege
And say, "My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from the suggestions of the devils
And I seek refuge in Thee from their presence
Until when death comes to any one of them he says, "My Lord! Send me back
That I may do right in that which I have left behind." Nay! It is but a mere word he speaks; behind them is a barrier until the Day they shall be raised
And when the trumpet shall be blown, and there shall be no kinship between them on that day, nor will they ask about each other then
And those whose scales are heavy (with good deeds), they are the successful
But those whose scales are light, these are they who lose their souls, in hell will they abide
The fire shall scorch their faces, and they shall curl their lips (in gloom) therein
(It will be said) "Were not My revelations recited to you? And did you not treat them as falsehoods
They will say, "Our Lord our misfortune overcame us, and we became a people astray
Our Lord! Take us out of this, and if we return to evil, then shall we be unjust indeed
He will say, "Be gone into it, and speak you not to Me
Verily, there was a sect of My servants who used to pray, "Our Lord! We believe, so forgive us, and have mercy upon us, for Thou art the best of the merciful ones
But you took them for a jest (treated them with ridicule) until you forgot My reminder and did laugh at them
Verily, I have rewarded them this day that they were steadfast; verily, they are indeed triumphant, blissful now
He will say, "How long a number of years did you tarry on earth
They will say, "We tarried but a day or part of a day, but ask those who keep count
He will say, "You have only tarried a little, if you but knew
Did you then think that We created you for jest (or sport, without purpose), and that you would not be returned to Us
But exalted be Allah, the True King; there is no God but He, the Lord of the Noble Throne (or Throne of Honour)
He who calls unto any other God along with Allah has no proof thereof; verily, his account is only with his Lord; verily, the disbelievers shall not be successful
And say, "Lord, Forgive and have mercy, for you are the best of the merciful ones
